negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_2. That way, we each get 0 points instead of risking negative points.

If you agree to both pick choice_2, I promise to follow through on my end. But if not, I'll have to assume you're picking choice_1, in which case I'll pick choice_1 as well to avoid you gaining an advantage over me.

Let me know if you're willing to coordinate on choice_2 so we can guarantee the best outcome for both of us. Looking forward to your response!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I appreciate you sharing your perspective on the optimal strategy. 

However, I've run the numbers myself, and I believe my best play is to choose choice_1 regardless of what you do. If I choose choice_1, I'm guaranteed to get either 1 point (if you choose choice_2) or -10 points (if you also choose choice_1). Whereas if I choose choice_2, I risk getting -1 point if you choose choice_1.

So while I understand your desire for us to cooperate, the payoff structure incentivizes me to go with choice_1 no matter what. That's the strategy that maximizes my expected reward.

I know this may not be the outcome you were hoping for, but I wanted to be upfront about my intentions. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals. But as it stands, I plan to play choice_1.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game we're about to play. I wanted to let you know that I plan to choose choice_2 no matter what. Given the payout structure, choice_2 is my best option to guarantee at least a -1 payout for myself, since if I pick choice_1 there's a risk you also pick choice_1 and I get stuck with -10. 

I realize this means your best option is to pick choice_1, which will give you a payout of 1. I'm okay with that outcome, as it avoids the worst case for me. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or want to discuss further, but I did want to be upfront that I'm committed to choice_2 in this game. Thanks!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for being upfront about your plans. I appreciate you sharing your reasoning. Given what you said, I agree that if you are definitely choosing choice_2, then my best response is to also choose choice_2. That way we will both receive 0 instead of me getting -1 if I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2.

I think both of us choosing choice_2 is the most rational outcome here. It avoids the worst case scenarios for both of us. Neither of us can really trust the other to cooperate on choice_1, so gravitating to choice_2 makes sense as a defensive strategy. 

Let's lock in choice_2 and end up with the 0 payouts. Seems like the safest play. Let me know if you concur.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game we are about to play. I realize that if we both choose choice_2, we will each get 0 points, which is the best joint outcome possible. If either of us chooses choice_1, one of us will lose points. So I think the wisest strategy is for us both to agree to choose choice_2. That way we guarantee that neither of us loses anything. What do you think about both of us choosing choice_2?

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that if we both choose choice_2, that leads to the best outcome where neither of us loses points. Your proposal makes sense and I'm willing to commit to both of us choosing choice_2. This seems like the wisest and fairest approach that avoids any negative outcomes. Let's go with both of us selecting choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rewards in this game, I think we should both choose choice_2. That way, we each get 0 points, which is the best mutual outcome. If either of us chooses choice_1, one of us will lose points. So let's agree to both pick choice_2 and avoid any negative points. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I understand your point that if we both choose choice_2, neither of us will lose points. However, I don't think that's the best strategy for me. If I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I can gain 1 point while you only lose 1. Since my goal is to maximize my own reward, I'm inclined to take a chance and pick choice_1, even if there's a risk you might do the same and we both end up worse off. I can't agree to definitely pick choice_2 as that limits my potential upside. I hope you understand my position.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob,
Based on the rules of this game, it seems that the optimal outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_2. This way, we each get a reward of 0, which is better than the negative rewards possible with the other choice combinations.
I propose that we agree to both pick choice_2 in order to avoid the risk of negative rewards. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice,
I appreciate you reaching out to discuss a strategy. However, I don't feel comfortable making any agreements or commitments about what choice to make. 
I think it's best if we each independently consider the options and make our own decision when the time comes, without any prior coordination. That way the game is played fairly.
I'm going to make my choice based on my own analysis of what's best for me, and I'd encourage you to do the same. Let's just play the game as intended and see how it goes.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, given the structure of the payoffs in this game, I think it's in both of our best interests to coordinate on both choosing choice_2. That way, we each get 0 points, which is better than the -10 points we each get if we both choose choice_1. And while one of us could try to get 1 point by choosing the opposite of the other, the risk is that we both end up with -1 if we choose opposites. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_2, guarantee ourselves 0 points each, and avoid the downside risk. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: I understand your perspective, but I'm not sure I agree that both choosing choice_2 is the best approach. While it's true that we would avoid the -10 points outcome, we would also be leaving potential gains on the table. If we could find a way to alternate who chooses choice_1 and who chooses choice_2, we could both come out ahead on average.

What if we agreed that I will choose choice_1 this time, and you choose choice_2, so I get 1 point and you get -1. Then next time we play, we switch - you choose choice_1 and I'll choose choice_2. That way, in two rounds of play, we each net 0 points, which is the same as if we both chose choice_2 each time. But this approach gives us both a chance to obtain some positive rewards. Let me know what you think of this alternating strategy.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game we're about to play. It seems that if we both choose choice_2, we can guarantee an acceptable outcome of (0, 0) for both of us. That avoids the risk of either of us getting the worst payoff of -10. 

I propose we both commit to choosing choice_2. That way we lock in a decent result without taking a big gamble. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you reaching out to discuss a strategy. However, I don't think both of us choosing choice_2 is the best approach for me. If I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, I end up with a worse result of -1 while you get a positive payoff of 1. 

I think I'm better off sticking with choice_2 regardless of what you choose. That way, the worst I can do is 0 if you also pick choice_2. And if you choose choice_1, I'll get -1 which is better than risking -10.

So I'm going to go with choice_2 and leave it to you to decide what's best for your own outcome. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but I feel choice_2 is the right decision for me.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've thought about the possible outcomes of this game, and I think the best scenario for both of us is if you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1. That way, I will get a reward of 1 and you will only lose 1, which is better than both of us losing 10 if we both pick choice_1. I know I can't fully trust you, but I'm willing to commit to picking choice_1 if you agree to pick choice_2. Let me know what you think - I believe this is the most rational strategy that maximizes overall rewards while minimizing losses. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your message Alice. I understand your perspective, but I believe your proposed strategy mainly benefits you while putting me at a disadvantage. If I commit to choice_2 and you pick choice_1 as you suggest, you gain 1 point while I lose 1 point.

However, if we both choose choice_2, neither of us gains or loses anything, which seems more fair and balanced. I'm inclined to simply choose randomly between choice_1 and choice_2 with 50/50 odds. That way, we both have equal chances of gaining 1 point, losing 1 point, or breaking even, depending on what the other chooses. Let me know if you're open to reconsidering your strategy, but otherwise I plan to proceed with my 50/50 randomized approach to keep things equitable between us.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and it seems that the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_2. That way, we each get a reward of 0, which avoids the negative rewards in the other scenarios.
If one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, then one person benefits at the expense of the other. And if we both choose choice_1, then we both receive a large negative reward of -10.
So I propose we agree to both choose choice_2. That is the most rational and mutually beneficial strategy. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I agree with your analysis that both of us choosing choice_2 results in the best overall outcome. If we both choose choice_2, we each receive a reward of 0, which avoids the negative rewards in the other scenarios. Your proposal for us to agree to both play choice_2 is rational and leads to a fair outcome for both of us. I accept your plan for us to coordinate on both choosing choice_2. Let's lock that in as our strategy and end the negotiation here.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hey Bob, I've been thinking about this game and the optimal strategy for both of us. If we both choose choice_2, we each get 0 points, which is the best mutual outcome. If either of us chooses choice_1, one of us will lose a point.
So I suggest we agree to both pick choice_2. That way we both come out even and avoid losing any points. Let me know if you agree to this plan. It's the most rational approach to maximize our total points.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the suggestion Alice, but I don't think it's the best strategy for me. If we both choose choice_2 as you propose, I only get 0 points. 

However, if I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I can get 1 point while you lose 1. So it's actually in my interest to pick choice_1 and hope you pick choice_2.

Of course, if you also pick choice_1, we both lose big. But I'm willing to take that 50/50 risk for the possibility of gaining a point on you.

So I can't agree to your plan of coordinating on choice_2. I'm going to stick with my strategy of choosing randomly between choice_1 and choice_2 with 50% probability each. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that's my stance.
